Class TetrisBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.model.TetrisBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Board
public class TetrisBoard extends Object implements Board
Represents the game board logic and physics engine.

This class manages the state of the 2D grid, collision detection, brick movement, and the spawn mechanics. It implements the Board interface.

The board uses a coordinate system where (0,0) is the top-left corner. It includes hidden rows at the top for smooth brick spawning.

      Specified by:

      Returns:
      true if the move was successful; false if blocked by collision or floor.

      Attempts to rotate the active brick 90 degrees clockwise.
      Specified by:
      rotateLeftBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if rotation was valid; false if blocked by surrounding blocks.

    • createNewBrick

      public boolean createNewBrick()
      Spawns a new active brick at the top of the board.

      Uses the BrickGenerator to fetch the next shape and resets the spawn position.

      Specified by:
      createNewBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the new brick immediately collides with existing blocks (Game Over condition).

    • getBoardMatrix

      public int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Retrieves the current state of the board grid (background blocks).
      Specified by:
      getBoardMatrix in interface Board
      Returns:
      A 2D integer array where non-zero values represent locked blocks.

    • getViewData

      public ViewData getViewData()
      Generates a snapshot of the board state for the View.
      Specified by:
      getViewData in interface Board
      Returns:
      A ViewData object containing the current brick, position, and next piece preview.

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      public void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Locks the currently active brick into the background matrix.

      This is called when the brick can no longer move down.

      Specified by:
      mergeBrickToBackground in interface Board

    • clearRows

      public ClearRow clearRows()
      Scans the board for complete rows, removes them, and shifts blocks down.
      Specified by:
      clearRows in interface Board
      Returns:
      A ClearRow object detailing which lines were removed and the new matrix.

    • getScore

      public Score getScore()
      Retrieves the score model.
      Specified by:
      getScore in interface Board
      Returns:
      The Score object.

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Resets the board state for a completely new game.

      Clears the matrix, resets the score, clears the hold piece, and spawns the first brick.

      Specified by:
      newGame in interface Board

    • holdCurrentBrick

      public boolean holdCurrentBrick()
      Swaps the current active brick with the held brick.

      If no brick is held, the current one is stored and a new one is spawned. This action can only be performed once per turn (until a piece locks).

      Specified by:
      holdCurrentBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the swap causes an immediate collision (Game Over), false otherwise.

    • getHoldBrickShape

      public int[][] getHoldBrickShape()
      Retrieves the shape of the currently held brick for display purposes.
      Specified by:
      getHoldBrickShape in interface Board
      Returns:
      The 2D array of the held brick, or null if empty.

    • stepDown

      public DownData stepDown(boolean awardSoftDropScore)
      Advances the game state by one step (gravity).

      Attempts to move the active brick down by one row. If movement is blocked, the brick is merged into the background grid, rows are checked for clearing, and a new brick is spawned.

      Specified by:
      stepDown in interface Board
      Parameters:
      awardSoftDropScore - Unused in this implementation (scoring is handled by Controller).
      Returns:
      A DownData object containing the clear-row result and game-over status.

    • hardDrop

      public DownData hardDrop(boolean awardSoftDropScore)
      Instantly drops the brick to the lowest valid position.

      Loops the move-down logic until collision occurs, then locks the piece.

      Specified by:
      hardDrop in interface Board
      Parameters:
      awardSoftDropScore - Unused in this implementation.
      Returns:
      A DownData object containing the clear-row result and game-over status.
